user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is: A project shall not contain unreachable code.

</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of MHD_connection_set_cork_state_:
```c
bool
MHD_connection_set_cork_state_ (struct MHD_Connection *connection,
                                bool cork_state)
{
#if defined(MHD_TCP_CORK_NOPUSH)
  const MHD_SCKT_OPT_BOOL_ off_val = 0;
  const MHD_SCKT_OPT_BOOL_ on_val = 1;
  int err_code;

  if (_MHD_YES == connection->is_nonip)
    return false;
  if (0 == setsockopt (connection->socket_fd,
                       IPPROTO_TCP,
                       MHD_TCP_CORK_NOPUSH,
                       (const void *) (cork_state ? &on_val : &off_val),
                       sizeof (off_val)))
  {
    connection->sk_corked = cork_state;
    return true;
  }

  err_code = MHD_socket_get_error_ ();
  if (MHD_SCKT_ERR_IS_ (err_code, MHD_SCKT_EINVAL_) ||
      MHD_SCKT_ERR_IS_ (err_code, MHD_SCKT_ENOPROTOOPT_) ||
      MHD_SCKT_ERR_IS_ (err_code, MHD_SCKT_ENOTSOCK_))
  {
    if (_MHD_UNKNOWN == connection->is_nonip)
      connection->is_nonip = _MHD_YES;
#ifdef HAVE_MESSAGES
    else
    {
      MHD_DLOG (connection->daemon,
                _ ("Setting %s option to %s state failed "
                   "for TCP/IP socket %d: %s\n"),
#ifdef TCP_CORK
                "TCP_CORK",
#else  /* ! TCP_CORK */
                "TCP_NOPUSH",
#endif /* ! TCP_CORK */
                cork_state ? _ ("ON") : _ ("OFF"),
                (int) connection->socket_fd,
                MHD_socket_strerr_ (err_code));
    }
#endif /* HAVE_MESSAGES */
  }
#ifdef HAVE_MESSAGES
  else
  {
    MHD_DLOG (connection->daemon,
              _ ("Setting %s option to %s state failed: %s\n"),
#ifdef TCP_CORK
              "TCP_CORK",
#else  /* ! TCP_CORK */
              "TCP_NOPUSH",
#endif /* ! TCP_CORK */
              cork_state ? _ ("ON") : _ ("OFF"),
              MHD_socket_strerr_ (err_code));
  }
#endif /* HAVE_MESSAGES */

#else  /* ! MHD_TCP_CORK_NOPUSH */
  (void) connection; (void) cork_state; /* Mute compiler warnings. */
#endif /* ! MHD_TCP_CORK_NOPUSH */
  return false;
}
```
</target_code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
suspicious_frags:
#ifdef HAVE_MESSAGES
    else
    {
      MHD_DLOG (connection->daemon,
                _ ("Setting %s option to %s state failed "
                   "for TCP/IP socket %d: %s\n"),
#ifdef TCP_CORK
                "TCP_CORK",
#else  /* ! TCP_CORK */
                "TCP_NOPUSH",
#endif /* ! TCP_CORK */
                cork_state ? _ ("ON") : _ ("OFF"),
                (int) connection->socket_fd,
                MHD_socket_strerr_ (err_code));
    }
#endif /* HAVE_MESSAGES */

#ifdef HAVE_MESSAGES
  else
  {
    MHD_DLOG (connection->daemon,
              _ ("Setting %s option to %s state failed: %s\n"),
#ifdef TCP_CORK
              "TCP_CORK",
#else  /* ! TCP_CORK */
              "TCP_NOPUSH",
#endif /* ! TCP_CORK */
              cork_state ? _ ("ON") : _ ("OFF"),
              MHD_socket_strerr_ (err_code));
  }
#endif /* HAVE_MESSAGES */
explanation: I reported code fragments that are conditionally compiled and therefore can be entirely absent (unreachable) for particular build configurations: the small #else branch that only mutes warnings when MHD_TCP_CORK_NOPUSH is not defined, and the two logging blocks guarded by HAVE_MESSAGES (which include nested TCP_CORK/TCP_NOPUSH alternatives). The remaining code (variable declarations, the connection->is_nonip checks, the setsockopt call and its handling, the err_code checks, assignments to connection->is_nonip and connection->sk_corked, the early returns and the final return false) are reachable in at least one compilation path and at runtime and do not present obvious unconditional unreachable code that would require investigation under MISRA C Rule 2.1.
